str2: Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The tongue; by implication, a language.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Little, small. Including the comparative mikroteros apparently a primary word; small (figuratively) dignity).
A bodily organ, limb, member. Of uncertain affinity; a limb or part of the body.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To boast, be arrogant, vaunt. From a compound of megas and aucheo; to talk big, i.e. Be grandiloquent.
Large, great, in the widest sense.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
Of which size, of what size, how small, how much. From helix; as big as, i.e. how much.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To kindle, set on fire, light. From ana and hapto; to enkindle.
Of which size, of what size, how small, how much. From helix; as big as, i.e. how much.
Wood, fuel. Perhaps akin to xulon; a forest, i.e. fuel.
